result.execSummary:
The defendant Shea S. KEAGLE was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody.
NO CONTEST plea entered to count 1, battery.  Convicted.
The State moves to dismiss and read in count 2.  Motion granted.
The Court comments and sentences the defendant to the Manitowoc County Jail for seventy-five (75) days, under the Huber Law, to commence immediately upon completion of the condition time which is scheduled to end on 07-27-16.
The defendant has credit for 12 days.
$543.00 court costs imposed, to be paid by 12-12-16 or 11 days county jail for failure to pay.
Court orders defendant to submit to a DNA sample.
MInutes.

Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
Cover Letter

Defendant in custody.
Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with District Attorney set for 04-29-16 at 10:30 a.m.   Plea date set for . 07-07-16 at 1:30 p.m.
Minutes.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of battery and disorderly conduct.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 03-21-16 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $650.00 recognizance bond with the condition that he maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.   Bail furnished and defendant is remanded into custody on a probation hold.
Minutes.
